title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 257-5.2 - Objective
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 §§ 257-5.2 - Objective

State Regulations

Hydrogen sulfide can cause odors which unreasonably
interfere with the comfortable enjoyment of life and property. Although
tarnishing of metals and discoloring of paint may occur at higher ambient air
concentrations the primary objective of this standard is to prevent
disagreeable odors. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
§§
257-5.2

Renumbered from 257-10.2

New

York State Register November 27, 2019/Volume XLI, Issue 48, eff. 12/7/2019

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
